result.purpose: This folder/module is responsible for defining various HTTP clients for interacting with external APIs and managing device-related operations.
result.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, where each file encapsulates a specific client functionality, promoting separation of concerns and reusability.

httpclient/athena.go.purpose: This file defines an HTTP client for linking accounts using the Athena API.
side_effects: Makes HTTP requests to an external API
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data in HTTP requests
Error handling may not cover all edge cases

httpclient/device.go.purpose: This file defines a DeviceClient interface and its implementation for managing device-related operations via HTTP requests.
side_effects: Logs warnings for not registered devices during address synchronization.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information if SecretKey is not handled securely.

httpclient/internal_client.go.purpose: This file implements an internal HTTP client with HMAC authentication for making requests to a specified URL.
risks: Potential exposure of SecretKey if not handled properly
Error handling may expose sensitive information in logs

httpclient/mercury.go.purpose: This file defines a MercuryClient interface and its implementation for sending notifications via HTTP.
side_effects: Logs errors when notification sending fails
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive information in logs if errors occur

httpclient/tracking.go.purpose: This file implements a tracking client for sending tracking requests asynchronously or synchronously.
side_effects: Sends HTTP requests to a specified URL
Executes tracking requests in a separate goroutine in TrackAsync
risks: Potential exposure of API key in logs or errors
Concurrency issues if not handled properly in TrackAsync
